Key Arguments: The bill undermines democratic values by determining what is considered correct information.
It creates a divide between ordinary citizens and an elite group of politicians, journalists, and experts.
The bill risks harming citizens by suppressing diverse opinions and dissenting voices.
It imposes extraterritorial jurisdiction, affecting global internet platforms and foreign entities.
The legislation is seen as an overreach that threatens freedom of speech and democratic principles.
Notable Quotes: This bill goes against all the principles of an inclusive society in the way it purports to determine what is correct information.
The suppression of facts deemed to be ‘misinformation’ or ‘disinformation’ is not an attempt to sort truth from lies, it is an attempt to silence dissent.
History tells us most clearly that this is the first step to Totalitarianism.
